poem:
Title: Iced Depths in Creation 

Ah, mankind's folly, bold in ink,
A story nested deep, within stories teetering on the brink.
The captain, the monster and the doc,
London's spine-'neath carnal block.
Ice forged man, on sled-dog steered,
Warm life from dead matter and fear.
Oh Mary, thy ink dost seep and quaver,
In your novel's cold, objective layer.
